Title.evidence: In this phase III randomized controlled multicenter trial (the SCANDIUM trial)

Trial_Design.evidence: The planned accrual was 90 patients randomized 1:1 to receive a one-time treatment with IHP or best alternative care.

Participants.evidence: patients with previously untreated isolated uveal melanoma liver metastases were included between 2013 and 2021

Intervention.evidence: randomized 1:1 to receive a one-time treatment with IHP or best alternative care

Objective.evidence: To investigate overall survival (OS) and health-related quality of life (HRQOL) of first-line isolated hepatic perfusion (IHP) compared to best alternative care for patients with uveal melanoma liver metastases.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was the 24-month OS rate

Number_Randomised.evidence: 87 patients randomized to the IHP group [43 patients; 41 (89%) received IHP] or the control group (44 patients)

Result_Outcome.evidence: median progression-free survival was 7.4 months in the IHP group compared with 3.3 months in the control group, with a hazard ratio of 0.21 (95% CI, 0.12â€“0.36)
